Interface DocumentManagerInterface

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    DocumentManager

    public interface DocumentManagerInterface

    • Method Detail

      • currentReaderStatus

        ReaderStatus currentReaderStatus()
        Returns the current Status of the Reader
        Returns:
        Status of the Reader - Absent or present

      • currentReaderActivityStatus

        ReaderActivityStatus currentReaderActivityStatus()
        Returns the current Activity of the Reader
        Returns:
        current Activity of the Reader - None, Reading, Idle

      • currentInBoxStatus

        java.util.Vector<java.lang.String> currentInBoxStatus()
        returns the position in the inbox, document names and priority of documents in the inbox
        Returns:
        Vector of Strings, i.e. 1. Document name - document priority (top of inbox) 2. Document name - document priority (next in inbox) returns "Inbox is empty" if no documents in inbox Example: 1. Quarterly Report - Urgent 2. Requirements for New Software - Normal 3. Department Managers - Low 4. Employees 10 year Awards - Low 5. Expectations for Region 4 - Urgent 6. Sales Report February 2012 - Normal

      • currentUrgentQueueStatus

        java.util.Vector<java.lang.String> currentUrgentQueueStatus()
        returns the position in the UrgentQueue, document names and priority of documents in the UrgentQueue
        Returns:
        Vector of Strings, i.e. 1. Document name (front of UrgentQueue) 2. Document name (next in UrgentQueue) returns "Urgent Priority Queue is empty" if no documents in Queue

      • currentNormalQueueStatus

        java.util.Vector<java.lang.String> currentNormalQueueStatus()
        returns the position in the NormalQueue, document names and priority of documents in the NormalQueue
        Returns:
        Vector of Strings, i.e. 1. Document name (front of NormalQueue) 2. Document name (next in NormalQueue) returns "Normal Priority Queue is empty" if no documents in Queue

      • currentLowQueueStatus

        java.util.Vector<java.lang.String> currentLowQueueStatus()
        returns the position in the LowQueue, document names and priority of documents in the LowQueue
        Returns:
        Vector of Strings, i.e. 1. Document name (front of LowQueue) 2. Document name (next in LowQueue) returns "Low Priority Queue is empty" if no documents in Queue

      • enterReader

        void enterReader()
        Changes ReaderStatus to present

      • exitReader

        void exitReader()
        Changes ReaderStatus to absent

      • getNumberDocuments

        int getNumberDocuments()
        Returns:
        number of documents in inbox

      • addDocument

        void addDocument(java.lang.String name,
               java.lang.String priority)
        Add a document to the inbox
        Parameters:
        name - name of document
        priority - priority of document

      • finishReadingDocument

        void finishReadingDocument()
        Changes activity status of reader from Reading to Idle

      • readDocument

        java.lang.String readDocument()
        Changes activity status of reader to Reading
        Returns:
        "false" if reader is not present

      • readStatus

        boolean readStatus()
        Returns:
        false if reader is not Reading, true if reader is reading

      • sortInbox

        void sortInbox()
        Sorts all documents in inbox to the Urgent Normal and Low Queues
